title: It was the need of the hour: Union Minister Chirag Paswan on caste-enumeration
content: Mr. Paswan who heads Lok Janshakti (Ramvilas) criticised the opposition for vying to take credit for the union government’s announcement to include caste enumeration along with decadal census

title: Tusker captured in Sakleshpur
content: The Forest Department took the initiative after local people staged protests demanding capture of wild elephants following recent incidents of human-elephant conflict

title: Water row: BBMB to release water to Haryana, CM Mann says won't tolerate robbery of Punjab's rights
content: The BBMB regulates water distribution from Bhakra, Pong and Ranjit Sagar dams. Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan are the partnering States that meet their requirement for different purposes, including irrigation, from Bhakra and Pong dams

title: Experience the wild up close at this portable Natural History Museum in Visakhapatnam
content: A portable Nature history museum by Wilded is sparking curiosity and connection with the wild through touch-and-feel exhibits and immersive storytelling in Visakhapatnam

title: NWKRTC suspends bus driver for offering namaz on duty in Karnataka
content: On April 30, images and videos of the NWKRTC driver stopping the bus on the Hangal-Vishalgad route to offer namaz were shared on social media

title: Mamata Banerjee visits fire-ravaged hotel in central Kolkata, promises action against guilty
content: Ms. Banerjee reached the Mechua Falpatti area of Burrabazar and said that special committees comprising police, administration and fire services department are being set up to identify establishments which are flouting fire safety norms

title: To improve purity of voters' list, EC to seek list of registered deaths from RGI electronically
content: The EC on May 1 said this will ensure that the Electoral Registration Officers receive timely information about registered deaths and allow booth level officers to re-verify the information through field visits

title: Mob lynching in Mangaluru: Inspector, two constables suspended for negligence
content: The inspector made use of the persons, who are accused of lynching, as complainant and witnesses to register a case of unnatural death though it was an incident of mob lynching

title: Congress never undertook caste census when in govt: BJP
content: When this decision was taken yesterday, some people were visibly agitated. They were saying ‘the government is theirs, but the system is ours,’ says Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan

title: In charged atmosphere, Pakistan chases ghosts of IAF fighters
content: Pakistan received an official warning about a potential Indian military offensive, leading to heightened tensions and claims of airspace violations. Amidst denials of involvement in a terrorist attack and accusations of escalating tensions, both sides face domestic pressures and international calls for dialogue. With authorized operational freedom for forces and family relocations, the risk of conflict looms large.

title: 'Iss baar ghar mein ghus kar baith jana': Owaisi urges govt to take PoK
content: Asaduddin Owaisi urged the BJP government to move beyond rhetoric and take decisive action against Pakistan by focusing on Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK). He reminded the government of the Parliament's resolution asserting India's claim over PoK. Owaisi highlighted past terror attacks and emphasized the need to eradicate terrorism, noting a national consensus among opposition parties on the issue.

title: Virat Kohli calls Anushka Sharma his 'safe space'
content: India’s star batter Virat Kohli shared a heartfelt message on Instagram to celebrate the birthday of his wife, actress Anushka Sharma. "To my best friend, my life partner, my safe space, my best half, my everything. You’re the guiding light of all of our lives. We love you so much more everyday. Happy birthday my love @anushkasharma," Virat wrote.

title: 'When I didn't see my name in the squad ... ': Suryakumar Yadav
content: Suryakumar Yadav reflected on his Mumbai Indians debut, revealing pre-game jitters and early struggles before becoming a key player. He recounted his pivotal 2018 season, opening unexpectedly and scoring over 500 runs, and shared insights from the tense 2019 IPL final. He made his IPL debut for Mumbai Indians in the 2012 season, playing against Pune Warriors at the Wankhede Stadium. However, his first outing was short-lived as he was dismissed for a duck—the only game he featured in that season.

title: Apple CEO on US-made iPhones: I don’t like to employ all these people foreign, but...
content: Apple CEO Tim Cook told Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick that advanced robotics are essential for bringing iPhone manufacturing to the U.S. Amid tariff concerns, Apple secured a temporary exemption, aiding stock recovery. While diversifying production to India, challenges persist with Chinese export approvals, framing this shift as part of an AI-driven industrial revolution with high-paying technician jobs.

title: GST collections in April hit record high of Rs 2.37 lakh crore
content: India's Goods and Services Tax (GST) revenue soared to a record Rs 2.37 lakh crore in April, marking a 12.6% year-on-year increase. This figure surpasses the previous high of Rs 2.10 lakh crore from April 2024.

title: April 2025 Car Sales: Maruti, Mahindra, Toyota grow, Tata Motors faces decline
content: In April 2025, the Indian auto market saw mixed results. Maruti Suzuki's total sales increased by 7%, while Hyundai and Tata Motors experienced declines. Mahindra & Mahindra and Kia India reported strong growth, particularly in the SUV segment. Toyota Kirloskar Motor and JSW MG Motor India also saw significant sales increases, with the MG Windsor EV leading in its segment.

title: EC takes 3 big steps to improve accuracy of electoral rolls
content: The Election Commission of India is enhancing the electoral process through three major initiatives. These include electronic acquisition of death registration data for prompt deletion of deceased voters, a redesigned Voter Information Slip for improved user experience, and standard photo identity cards for Booth Level Officers to boost voter outreach and confidence.

title: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella has a ‘solution’ to reduce impact of Trump Tariffs
content: Microsoft navigated initial US tariffs with minimal direct product exposure, emphasizing software solutions to mitigate client pressures. CEO Satya Nadella highlighted software's role in combating inflationary pressures, focusing on customer support and shared gains. While shielded by its software focus, Microsoft faces potential indirect effects from reduced client spending and increased equipment costs, particularly for AI-related hardware.

title: How a 'gedi' chat gave PBKS' Prabhsimran Singh a reality check
content: There has never been a doubt about Prabhsimran Singh’s talent. There was a reason why in 2018, Kings XI Punjab (now Punjab Kings), Mumbai Indians, and Royal Challengers Bangalore were involved in a fierce bidding war for the then 18-year-old. Prabhsimran ended up being a teen crorepati when he was picked for Rs 4.8 crores by the Punjab franchise. In 2020, he impressed Sachin Tendulkar with his bat swing, but it took him five years to find that consistency.

title: 'Prevented major terror incident': BSF-Punjab Police bust arms haul in Amritsar
content: In a joint operation, the Border Security Force and Punjab Police seized a significant cache of arms and ammunition from Bharopal village in Amritsar district. The recovered items included two hand grenades, three pistols with six magazines, and 50 live rounds. A BSF official highlighted that this coordinated effort averted a potential major terror incident.

title: Kris Srikkanth slams LSG coach for handling Rishabh Pant poorly
content: Kris Srikkanth has criticized Lucknow Super Giants' handling of Rishabh Pant, questioning Justin Langer and Zaheer Khan's decisions. Pant, acquired for a substantial sum, has underperformed, and Srikkanth questioned his late appearance in a recent match. Anil Kumble also expressed concerns about Pant's batting position and perceived frustration, highlighting potential mismanagement.

title: V-P Dhankhar, PM Modi greet people of Maharashtra, Gujarat on States' formation day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi greeted the people of Maharashtra and Gujarat and said ‘Its glorious history and the courage of the people come to our mind’.

title: SC dismisses PIL seeking judicial probe into Pahalgam terror attack
content: The top court pulls up petitioners for filing PIL on Pahalgam attack, says judges not experts in probe of terror cases

title: 'Sharbat jihad' row: Ramdev beyond anyone's control, lives in own world, says Delhi HC
content: Hamdard National Foundation India filed a plea against Ramdev and his Patanjali Foods Ltd over the controversial remarks

title: Right time for ‘create in India, create for world’: PM Modi calls WAVES 2025 global celebration of creativity
content: PM Modi batted for creative responsibility, saying technology is playing an increasingly important role in people’s lives and extra effort was needed to maintain human sensitivity

title: Govt gave headline but where is deadline: Congress on Centre's caste census move
content: You should have gotten the census done in 2021. They cite the COVID pandemic, but more than 50 countries did their census during COVID. The pandemic was not there in 2023, 2024, but they did not get it done, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Rescued Bengal young adults find success after being freed from bonded labour in Tamil Nadu
content: About 60 children and young adults were rescued from Tamil Nadu in 2019, 22 in 2023, 54 in 2023, and seven in 2024 and they received psychological, career counselling by State Government and NGOs

title: Pahalgam attack 'barbaric', Modi a fighter who will bring peace to J&K: Rajinikanth at WAVES Summit in Mumbai
content: Addressing the inaugural WAVES Summit, Rajinikanth said many people had told him the government might postpone the four-day event because of "unnecessary criticism" as it focused on entertainment

title: Revanth Reddy hails BC caste census announcement, offers Telangana model as blueprint
content: Highlighting Telangana’s proactive role, Mr. Reddy said the State not only passed a resolution in its Assembly but also executed a comprehensive caste census

title: More than 1700 money laundering cases in trial stage: ED director
content: A total of 1,739 cases of PMLA are under trial at present, and the delay in prosecution in the money laundering cases can be attributed to general delay in the justice system in the country

title: Madhya Pradesh farmers involved in stubble burning to lose Kisan Samman Nidhi aid
content: The State Cabinet suspends financial aid for farmers burning stubble to control pollution, impacting minimum support price purchases for a year

title: With WAVES event, government seeks global role for India in entertainment industry
content: Spanning streaming to filmmaking to video gaming to visual effects, the government has pitched May’s WAVES event as a step in establishing India as a hub in the global entertainment business

title: Supreme Court restrains DDA from shifting deer remaining in Delhi's Deer Park
content: A Bench of Justices Abhay. S Oka and Ujjal Bhuyan issued notice to the horticulture director of DDA and others while seeking their response on a plea opposing the relocation of deers

title: Video clip of security personnel waving National Flag on Karregutta hill range garners social media attention
content: The video doing the rounds on the social media also showed a chopper landing along the Karregutta hill ranges even as the massive anti-Maoist operation near Chhattisgarh-Telangana border

title: 26/11 Mumbai attack: Delhi court allows NIA to record Tahawwur Rana's voice, handwriting samples
content: Special National Investigation Agency Judge Chander Jit Singh, who on April 28 extended Rana's custody for 12 days, passed the order on April 30 on an application moved by the agency

title: Upset Google CEO calls US govt proposal to break Google: "So far-reaching, so …"
content: Sundar Pichai voiced strong objections to the DOJ's proposed remedies in Google's antitrust case, cautioning they could cripple Google Search and jeopardize user privacy. He argued that demands to share search data and potentially sell Chrome would undermine innovation and devalue Google's investments. Pichai also highlighted privacy risks associated with the data-sharing proposal.

title: 'He lives in his own world': Delhi HC pulls up Ramdev over 'sharbat jihad' row
content: The Delhi High Court has found Yoga guru Ramdev in prima facie contempt for violating a previous order regarding his "sharbat jihad" remarks against Hamdard's Rooh Afza. Justice Amit Bansal noted that Ramdev published a video with objectionable content despite the court's directive prohibiting such statements. The court expressed strong disapproval of Ramdev's remarks, deeming them "indefensible.""He (Ramdev) is not in control of anyone. He lives in his own world," the judge remarked.

title: Bank Holidays in May 2025: Check state-wise full list
content: Bank Holidays May 2025: In May 2025, bank holidays will vary across Indian states, impacting banking services. Closures are scheduled for Labour Day/Maharashtra Day, Rabindranath Tagore Jayanti, Buddha Purnima, State Day, Kazi Nazrul Islam's Birthday, and Maharana Pratap Jayanti.

title: Want to demoralise forces? SC raps PIL seeking judicial probe into J&K attack
content: The Supreme Court dismissed petitions requesting a judicial investigation, overseen by a retired SC judge, into the deadly terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that resulted in 26 fatalities. The court admonished the petitioners for filing Public Interest Litigations, stating that judges lack expertise in terror case investigations and cautioned against demoralizing the forces with such petitions.

title: Watch: Cong workers pour milk on Rahul's poster to mark caste census push
content: Congress workers in Hyderabad celebrated the Centre's decision to conduct a caste census by pouring milk on posters of Rahul Gandhi and Telangana CM Revanth Reddy.

title: When Pak actress Hania Aamir expressed her desire to meet Shah Rukh Khan
content: Pakistani actress Hania Aamir, known for her Bollywood fandom, especially for Shah Rukh Khan, once expressed her desire to meet the superstar. However, escalating political tensions between India and Pakistan have impacted online accessibility. Following a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir, the Indian government banned several Pakistani media outlets.

title: Aston Martin unveils new DBX S with increased horsepower engine, new features
content: Aston Martin has unveiled the DBX S, a high-performance SUV slated for release in late 2025. Boasting a 717 bhp engine and a top speed of 193 mph, it's the most powerful ICE SUV ever. Enhanced with design tweaks, carbon-fibre elements, and superior agility, the DBX S aims to surpass rivals like Lamborghini Urus SE and Ferrari Purosangue.

title: Punjab CM accuses Haryana, Centre of ‘bullying’ and ‘hooliganism’ over water
content: Bhagwant Mann accuses BJP of bullying Punjab over water. He claims Haryana seeks excess water for irrigation. Mann asserts Punjab cannot spare water due to its own shortages. He alleges a BJP conspiracy to deprive Punjab of its water resources. Mann states Punjab will supply water to Haryana for drinking purposes only.

title: Pahalgam attack: Fearing covert op, Pak steps up LeT chief Hafiz Saeed's security
content: Following the Pahalgam terror attack, ISI and the Pakistan government have heightened security for Lashkar-e-Taiba chief Hafiz Saeed, fearing a covert operation. Former Special Service Group commandos have been assigned to his protection, with increased security at his residences. Lawrence Bishnoi syndicate has also threatened retaliation for the Pahalgam killings, vowing to target a high-value individual in Pakistan.

title: 26/11 attack: Court allows NIA to record Tahawwur Rana's voice, handwriting samples
content: A Delhi court has granted the National Investigation Agency (NIA) permission to collect voice and handwriting samples from Tahawwur Hussain Rana, an accused in the 26/11 Mumbai terror attack. Rana, an associate of David Coleman Headley, was extradited to India after his appeal was dismissed by the US Supreme Court.

title: Caste census: BJP counters Cong's ‘sarkar tumhari, system humara’ slogan
content: The BJP has criticized the Congress party regarding the inclusion of caste-based enumeration in the upcoming census, questioning their historical inaction. Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan accused former PM Nehru of opposing caste-based reservations, leading to the discontinuation of caste census after 1931.

title: Lord's to host 2026 Women's T20 World Cup final
content: Lord's will host the 2026 Women's T20 World Cup final, marking a defining moment for women's cricket. The tournament, featuring 12 teams and 33 games, begins June 12, with the final set for July 5. Other venues include The Oval, Old Trafford, and Edgbaston, as England aims to build on the legacy of the 2017 World Cup.

title: Kashmiri shawl vendors assaulted in Mussoorie for 'Pahalgam revenge'
content: In Mussoorie, two Kashmiri shawl vendors were assaulted by locals, claiming it was retaliation for the Pahalgam terror attack, leading to arrests and apologies. Sixteen vendors reportedly left the town fearing for their safety, leaving behind goods worth lakhs.

title: 'Jhukti hai duniya': Rahul Gandhi posters crop up after Centre's caste census nod
content: Following the Union Cabinet's approval of caste-based data collection in the upcoming census, posters emerged outside Congress and RJD offices, celebrating leaders Rahul Gandhi and Lalu Prasad Yadav's advocacy for a caste census. Gandhi welcomed the decision but urged for a clear timeline, emphasizing it as an initial step towards comprehensive social reform, attributing the development to sustained political and public pressure.

title: Final goodbye? MS Dhoni's heart-warming meet-and-greet with CSK owners goes viral
content: Chennai Super Kings, led by MS Dhoni, faced elimination from the IPL playoff race after a four-wicket defeat against Punjab Kings at their home ground. Despite fifties from Shreyas Iyer and Prabhsimran Singh, and a hat-trick by Yuzvendra Chahal, PBKS secured the victory.

title: Tax return: New ITR-1 form notified with major changes - check details
content: The Income Tax Department has introduced new ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms for FY 2024-25, simplifying tax filing for individuals with long-term capital gains up to Rs 1.25 lakh from listed equities. These forms feature modifications for deductions and require detailed TDS information. This change aims to enhance taxpayer services and encourage voluntary compliance by reducing the complexity for small taxpayers.

title: ISI chief gets additional role as NSA as India-Pakistan tensions flare
content: Pakistan has appointed its current ISI chief, Lt Gen Muhammad Asim Malik, as the new National Security Adviser amidst escalating tensions with India following the Pahalgam terror attack. This marks the first instance of a serving ISI director general holding both crucial positions simultaneously. The notification stated, "Lt Gen Muhammad Asim Malik HI (M), DG (I), shall hold the additional charge of the National Security Adviser, with immediate effect."

title: Police launch probe into Dilli Haat fire that gutted over 30 shops
content: We have launched a detailed investigation into the fire incident that took place at Dilli Haat. We have formed multiple teams, a senior police officer informs.

title: BJP’s Dilip Ghosh rejects speculations of joining TMC after meeting Bengal CM Mamata at Digha Jagannath temple
content: Our party did not ask us to skip the invitation. I have been invited, and that is the reason I have come here. I have got the guts to do so, said Dilip Ghosh

title: Andhra Pradesh government eases registration burden for NTR Smart Township plot buyers
content: The move, aimed at reducing financial stress on buyers, introduces a two-document registration system that significantly lowers upfront registration costs

title: A.P. police to impose traffic diversions for PM Modi’s tour on May 2
content: The traffic restrictions will be in force from 5 a.m. to 10 p.m. on May 2, says a release issued from the DGP office

title: Modi govt presided over 'widespread depredation' of India's workers: Congress
content: Self- employment rose from 51% in 2017-18 to a shocking 57% in 2022-23, while salaried work fell from 23% to 21%. The number of unpaid workers in the self-employed category has shot up from about 40 million in 2017-18 to 95 million in 2022-23, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Himachal’s remote Lahaul-Spiti district leads the way in women empowerment
content: H.P. govt appointed Kiran Bhadana, a 2017-batch IAS officer, as the first woman Deputy Commissioner of Lahaul-Spiti — a tribal district known for its customary exclusion of daughters, particularly married ones, from inheritance rights

title: Odisha transfers ₹1025 crore to 51 lakh farmers’ account on Akshaya Tritiya
content: The State sets a target to bring 15 lakh hectares of land under irrigation in the next five years, with an investment of around ₹1,00,000 crore, says Odisha CM

title: BJP-led Union govt.’s sudden move to conduct caste census reeks of political expediency: T.N. CM Stalin
content: The Chief Minister said that the caste census was essential, not optional, for objective policy making, targeted welfare, and social justice

title: Operation Hawk-2025: CBI cracks down on child sexual exploitation networks
content: After registering the case, the agency conducted searches at various locations in Delhi linked to the accused and seized evidence

title: Press bodies demand restoration of ‘4 PM’ News YouTube channel
content: Through a joint statement, the Press Club of India, Indian Women’s Press Corps, Delhi Union of Journalist, Press Association, and Kerala Union of Working Journalists (Delhi Unit) said the YouTube channel of 4 PM News, was blocked on the Union government’s order

title: Kolkata fire: Owner and manager of hotel arrested
content: 12 of the 14 bodies have been identified and post mortem has been performed. Post mortem of the bodies have revealed that deaths death were due to effects of Asphyxia due to inhalation of carbon soot and also thermal burn injuries.

title: Caste census by Union Government will clear confusion over Karnataka data, says BJP
content: Former Deputy CM C.N. Ashwath Narayan claimed that the Congress government in Karnataka had conducted a caste census in the guise of Socio-Economic and Educational Survey, though it did not have the authority to take up such a census

title: Hyderabad Police redraws jurisdictional map, adds new stations and units for smarter policing
content: The law and order (L&O) and Traffic wings have been further strengthened with the addition of 327 and 321 personnel respectively, all through internal reallocation within the sanctioned police strength of 17,020

title: Land dispute clash: Prohibitory order imposed in Manipur’s Tamenglong after clash leaves 25 injured
content: The incident happened when about 2,000 residents of Old Tamenglong village were marching to the Deputy Commissioner and SP’s office to submit a memorandum over the land dispute

title: A.P. government’s help sought to run JIPMER’s Super Speciality Centre in Yanam
content: Pointing out that 75% of the patients approaching the facility are from A.P.,  JIPMER Director urges the Health Minister to appoint doctors and nurses there on deputation

title: IIT Madras opens admissions for BS programmes in data science and electronic systems
content: The last date to apply is May 20. Those with JEE Main will be admitted directly, while others must undergo a qualifying test

title: PM Modi at Waves Summit 2025 LIVE: We need to save young generations from tendencies against humanism, says PM Modi
content: The PMO said WAVES 2025 is a first-of-its-kind summit in India; PM Modi promised further initiatives like WAVES awards in the near future

title: ‘Bengaluru by 2030 is expected to have a home furnishing potential of about ₹216 billion’
content: Bengaluru is a huge growth market, along with Delhi, and one of the priority markets of IKEA, says its Country Expansion Manager Pooja Grover

title: In US, reinstated international students at risk again after new ICE memo
content: A new ICE memo threatens international students whose SEVIS records were recently reinstated, potentially creating gaps in their records and jeopardizing their legal status. This policy allows for SEVIS termination based on visa revocations, raising concerns about due process and potential deportation. Immigration attorneys anticipate legal challenges to address these issues and protect students from adverse consequences.

title: Who deserves credit? BJP, Congress lock horns over caste census decision
content: The Indian government's decision to include caste enumeration in the upcoming census has ignited political debate, with the BJP and opposition Congress both vying for credit. While Congress claims it as a victory for Rahul Gandhi's advocacy, the BJP highlights Congress's historical opposition to caste-based census. The move aims to gather data on caste distribution for informed policy-making.

title: Shops vandalised, slogans raised in Nainital over rape of Class 7 girl
content: A protest occurred in Nainital's Mallital area. This followed the alleged rape of a minor girl by a contractor named Usman. The victim is a Class 7 student. Outraged community members gathered, demanding action. Protests spread, resulting in vandalism of shops. Police detained Usman. Investigations are underway to ensure justice for the victim and her family.

title: Watch: Ever wonder what it's like to be at White House? US press secy shows you
content: Karoline Leavitt, the US press secretary, shared a rare video tour of the White House, offering a glimpse into her daily life and responsibilities. She highlighted key areas like the press briefing room and her office, emphasizing the importance of communicating the President's message effectively. Leavitt underscored that the White House ultimately belongs to the American people.

title: Move away from China? Apple exports 97.6% of iPhones to US from India
content: Apple dramatically increased iPhone exports from India to the US in March 2025, reaching 97.6% of total exports, driven by concerns over potential tariffs on Chinese goods. This shift involves expanding Indian production with manufacturers like Tata Electronics and Foxconn, aiming for a complete transition of US-bound iPhone production from China to India by 2026.

title: IPL 2025: Can MS Dhoni-led CSK still qualify for playoffs?
content: Chennai Super Kings' struggles continued as they suffered their eighth defeat in the ongoing IPL season, succumbing to Punjab Kings by 4 wickets. This loss marks their third consecutive defeat, leaving them at the bottom of the standings with only 4 points.

title: Unprovoked firing by Pakistan continues for seventh straight day; India retaliates
content: Pakistani forces have engaged in unprovoked firing across the Line of Control for the seventh consecutive day, prompting a proportionate response from the Indian Army in Kupwara, Uri, and Akhnoor. This ceasefire violation occurred despite recent talks between the Directors General of Military Operations of both nations, where India warned Pakistan against such actions.

title: Karnataka roadways bus driver offers namaz during duty hours, faces probe
content: A departmental investigation has begun against A K Mulla. He is a driver with the North West Karnataka Road Transport Corporation. Mulla was seen offering Namaz inside a parked bus. Passengers were inside the bus at the time. A passenger recorded a video of the incident. The video went viral. Officials are investigating the circumstances surrounding the event.

title: Canada recalls popular anti-aging cream for failing safety tests
content: Watier cosmetics' anti-aging cream has been recalled in Canada due to microbial contamination. Health Canada identified Lactobacillus pentosus, a probiotic, in the Age Control Supreme Sublime Advanced Rich day cream, sold at Shoppers Drug Mart and Amazon. While L. pentosus poses minimal health risks, the product failed to meet microbial standards.

title: MS Dhoni blames batters after CSK bow out from playoff race in IPL 2025
content: MS Dhoni criticized the Chennai Super Kings' batting performance after their four-wicket defeat to Punjab Kings, which resulted in their elimination from playoff contention. Despite Sam Curran's impressive 88 and support from Dewald Brevis, CSK fell short of a par score, according to Dhoni.

title: International Labour Day 2025: 60+ Wishes & quotes to celebrate workers' rights
content: Labour Day, celebrated annually on May 1st, honors the contributions and struggles of workers worldwide. Originating from the 1886 Haymarket event, it acknowledges the labor movement's fight for fair conditions and decent pay. The day is marked by parades and speeches, emphasizing the dignity of work and worker rights, with quotes from notable figures highlighting labor's value.

title: Ting! Preity Zinta a 'happy girl' after PBKS' win over CSK
content: Preity Zinta, co-owner of Punjab Kings, expressed her joy after their thrilling four-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings. Punjab's successful chase of 191 was fueled by strong performances from openers and a captain's knock, securing a crucial win. Despite MS Dhoni's assessment that their score was slightly short, CSK's loss eliminated them from playoff contention.

title: Unhappy with hubby’s beard, woman elopes with his ‘clean shaven’ brother
content: In Meerut, a man named Mohammad Shakir reported his wife, Arshi, missing after she allegedly eloped with his younger brother, Mohammad Sabir. The bizarre incident stemmed from Arshi's persistent demand that Shakir shave his beard, a request he refused. After Arshi vanished on February 3rd, Shakir discovered his brother was also gone.

title: Trump plays down China tariff impact, says US kids may get '2 dolls instead of 30'
content: US President Trump defended his tariff strategy despite economic slowdown signs, suggesting Americans might face fewer and costlier products. He insisted China would bear the brunt of the economic pain, dismissing recession concerns and attributing market jitters to his predecessor. While touting foreign investment, his administration faced criticism over contradictory messaging and the potential for economic instability due to trade tensions.

title: Pakistan violates LoC ceasefire in Kupwara, Uri for 7th straight night; Indian Army responds
content: Pakistan has engaged in unprovoked firing across the LoC since Thursday after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty in response to the Pahalgam terror attack which killed 26 people, mostly tourists in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22

title: Bombay High Court disposed of Shiv Sena MLA’s PIL on misuse of digital platforms by influencers
content: The petitioner sought urgent intervention against influencers, creators and comedians who use the platforms for their personal gain while propagating scandalous, derogatory and contemptuous material

title: Indians fear fake news but are less concerned about press freedom
content: In India, the share of people who believe that media freedom exists is higher than the share of people who believe it is important

title: Caste Census decision is victory of PDA, says Akhilesh
content: Samajwadi Party president hails caste census decision as victory for Opposition and PDA social segments, marking start of “democratic movement”

title: PM Modi to visit Maharashtra, Kerala, Andhra Pradesh on May 1 and 2
content: Prime Minister to inaugurate WAVES 2025 summit in Mumbai and Vizhinjam International Deepwater Multipurpose Seaport in Kerala

title: Rainfall to continue in Dakshina Kannada, Udupi till May 4
content: Udupi district recorded 1.3 mm rainfall in 24 hours ending at 8.30 a.m. on Wednesday (April 30, 2025)

title: Pahalgam attack LIVE: SC rejects plea seeking judicial probe into terror strike in J&K
content: Pakistan’s Olympic gold-winning javelin thrower Arshad Nadeem’s Instagram account has been blocked in India owing to a “legal request”

title: Government’s negligence led to death of seven devotees at Simhachalam: YSRCP leader Jagan
content: Adequate measures have not been taken despite knowing that the festival attracts lakhs of devotees, he said

title: Sharad Pawar supports discussion on Pahalgam attack, calls for national unity
content: The terror attack in Kashmir was called as a ‘serious issue’ and said all parties should stand together on matters of national security

title: Modi to lay stone and dedicate development projects in Amaravati worth over ₹58,000 crore on May 2
content: The projects mainly include the Legislative Assembly, High Court, Secretariat, other administrative buildings and houses for the poor costing about ₹11,240 crore

title: Simhachalam tragedy: was the wall built of paper, ask angry kin of deceased
content: The KGH premises echoed with heart-wrenching cries as grieving families mourned the death of their loved ones

title: BJD welcomes Union Cabinet’s decision to include caste enumeration in census exercise
content: BJD has been repeatedly demanding countrywide caste census and removal of 50% cap on reservation, says BJD supemo and former CM Naveen Patnaik

title: NCW forms panel to probe Bhopal rape and blackmail cases; five survivors come out
content: The Bhopal police had earlier formed a special investigation team (SIT) which is currently probing the cases.

title: CPI(M) opposes approval of Sainik School named after M.P.’s Minister’s late nephew; alleges criminal record against him
content: The NGO was formed in May 2023 after the death of Maninagendra Singh alias Monu Patel, son of Mr. Patel’s brother and former BJP MLA Jalam Singh Patel.

title: BJP leader Dilip Ghosh meets West Bengal CM Mamata at Digha Jagannath temple, draws party ire
content: State BJP president Sukanta Majumdar said that Dilip Ghosh’s visit does not have endorsement of the party.

title: Digha’s Jagannath Temple will be an important pilgrimage for centuries,  says West Bengal CM; opens its door for public
content: The ₹250 crore temple has been built over 20 acres of land is similar to the 12th century temple at Puri of the same deities

title: VACB arrests Kochi Corporation official on charge of taking bribe
content: The building inspector of the Corporation’s zonal office at Vyttila, had allegedly sought ₹15,000 for processing an application seeking a building number

title: NGT slams Collector for not filing action-taken report on Thripunitura explosion
content: The Southern Bench of the tribunal said in its order dated April 25, 2025, that the report by the District Collector had not been filed yet, despite several opportunities being offered

title: Everything I saw at RSS school started to unfold at BHU: JNUSU president Nitish Kumar
content: Mr. Kumar, JNUSU’s new president from Left Unity, reflects on his early exposure to one side of the ideological spectrum and search for an alternative

title: Police zero in on kingpins behind recent drug trafficking cases in Kozhikode
content: Involvement of more foreign nationals suspected; anti-narcotics squad reportedly makes headway in identifying smugglers’ networks

title: Caste census: After declining it for years, RSS leader backs caste census
content: Mr Joshi, on several occasions in the past, had declined the idea of caste census and so did the RSS, the ideological parent of the Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

title: GI tag sought for Pollachi tall coconut
content: The application was filed by Coimbatore Coconut Producer Company Limited along with Vinayaga Coconut Farmer Producer Company Limited, Anaimalai Coconut Producer Company Limited and Pollachi Poorna Producer Company Limited

content: “We are in touch with the governments of India and Pakistan, not just at the Foreign Minister level, but at multiple levels,” says Washington

title: Bengaluru-based builder booked for cheating
content: The problem cropped up in January 2024 when a group of people claiming ownership of the flats told the residents of the building to vacate

title: Private school in Bengaluru booked for forging fire safety NOC to avail affiliation
content: The forgery came to light when the school was accused of constructing a building on a stormwater drain

title: India closes its airspace to airlines from Pakistan
content: Sources said that a NOTAM (Notice to Airmen) has been issued that bars Pakistan airlines from using the Indian airspace.

title: Police register FIR after Aligarh school student is forced to urinate on Pakistan flag
content: Targeting the student in this manner created divisions in society and helped Pakistan’s agenda, the Congress said

title: NDA partners and Opposition celebrate Centre’s decision to conduct caste count
content: Both Samajwadi Party and RJD have claimed victory for themselves, with former UP CM Akhilesh Yadav claiming that the decision is a result of “collective pressure”, while leader of opposition in Bihar assembly Tejashwi Yadav termed it “ideological victory”. At the same time, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar commended the decision, Lok Janshakti Party (Ramvilas) leader & Union Minister Chirag Paswan said the government has neutralised the opposition with this move

title: Four panchaloha idols of Adi Shankarcharya made near Swamimalai to be installed at Kedarnath, Badrinath
content: A team of 15 artisans proficient in chiseling, designing, engraving and polishing among others were involved in making the idols in sitting posture giving them an antique finish

title: Ministers from about 30 countries confirm participation in WAVES summit; PM Modi to inaugurate the event on Thursday
content: Th event aims to position India as a creative and technological force across industries, from cinema and television to AI, immersive reality, gaming, and digital media

title: Gobert, Wolves beat 'the best' in ousting Lakers
content: The Timberwolves advanced to the Western Conference semifinals with a 103-96 win over the Lakers that eliminated LeBron James and Luka Doncic from their first postseason together.

title: LeBron on his future: 'I don't have the answer'
content: LeBron James wasn't ready to make any decisions about his future in the moments immediately after his 22nd NBA season ended with the Lakers' first-round playoff exit.

title: Fan critical after falling from 21-foot wall at PNC
content: A fan was removed from the field on a cart after falling from the 21-foot Clemente Wall in right field at PNC Park during Wednesday night's Cubs-Pirates game.

title: Dubs irked as Rockets take aim at Curry's thumb
content: Warriors coach Steve Kerr said Rockets defenders are trying to "outsmart the rules" by hitting Stephen Curry's hand after he releases his shot and said it's something he hopes the league addresses after the season.

title: FA to ban trans players from women's football
content: The English Football Association (FA) has said it will ban transgender players from women's football from next season, starting from June 1.

title: Ovi, Caps finish Habs in first series win since Cup
content: The Capitals beat the Canadiens on Wednesday night to advance in the Stanley Cup playoffs, their first series victory since winning it all in 2018.

title: Lightning concede it's Panthers' turn to rule rivalry
content: Lightning coach Jon Cooper tipped his cap after the Panthers eliminated his team in five games, saying, "It was our turn for a while. Now it's theirs."

title: Riveras added as defendants in sexual abuse suit
content: Former Yankees closer Mariano Rivera and his wife, Clara, have been added as named defendants in a civil lawsuit filed by a girl and her mother, who say the girl was sexually abused at events connected to the Riveras' church.

title: Barça, Inter, Yamal deliver perfect Champions League night
content: Barça-Inter didn't go to script, and that unpredictability made for a brilliant Champions League semifinal.

title: College Football Playoff impact: Players who stuck around
content: The portal has closed, the draft is over, so who are the best players who stuck around even though they had options?

title: What another disappointing first-round loss means for Giannis and the Bucks: 'I don't know'
content: Year 2 of the Giannis-Dame partnership was supposed to fuel a title run in Milwaukee. Where can the franchise turn now after another first-round exit?

title: Damian Lillard's injury timeline, plus what to learn from other NBA stars' Achilles tears
content: The Bucks guard faces a long recovery, but there is precedent for stars in their 30s making a full comeback.

title: From Rory to JT, looking back at top players and moments
content: Through half of the 2025 season we've seen Rory McIlroy dominate, Justin Thomas get back in the winner's circle and Scottie Scheffler start a bit slower than expected.

title: Inter Miami has little to show for its star-studded roster
content: Wednesday night's elimination made it more clear than ever: Time is running out for Messi and Co. to win the silverware Miami craves.

title: How ruthless Chelsea romped to a sixth consecutive WSL title
content: Wednesday's win over Man Utd confirmed a sixth-consecutive league title for Chelsea; Sonia Bompastor's first and just two games away from an invincible campaign.

title: "Why Didn't They...": Chirag Paswan Slams Opposition's Caste Census Claims
content: Union Minister and BJP ally Chirag Paswan has hit out at opposition parties, including Congress, for claiming credit for the Narendra Modi government's decision to record caste data in the next Census

title: Epicenter Of Iranian Port Blast Tied To Charity With Links To Supreme Leader Ayatollah Khamenei
content: The explosion that rocked an Iranian port, killing at least 70 people and injuring more than 1,000 others, had its epicenter at a facility ultimately owned by a charitable foundation overseen by Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's office.

title: "Country Going To Pay... ": When Rajiv Gandhi Opposed 1990 Reservation Move
content: As the ruling BJP and the Opposition Congress wage a political battle to claim credit for yesterday's announcement, here is a look at how the Grand Old Party responded to the Mandal Commission's report 35 years back and the grounds on which it oppose

title: Mamata Banerjee Visits Fire-Ravaged Hotel, Promises Action Against Guilty
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee visited the fire-ravaged hotel in central Kolkata and announced that those responsible for the death of 14 people will not be spared.

title: US Nurse Has Sex With Teen Stepson, Caught By Husband, Loses License
content: The Florida Department of Health has revoked the medical license of a nurse, who was allegedly in a sexual relationship with her 15-year-old stepson. The man discovered his wife, Alexis Von Yates, had an inappropriate relationship with his teen son.

title: Owner, Manager Of Kolkata Hotel, Where Fire Killed 14, Arrested
content: The owner and the manager of the central Kolkata hotel, where a devastating fire killed 14 people, were arrested on Thursday, police said.

title: Columbia Student Mohsen Mahdawi, Detained In US Over Gaza Protests, Released
content: Mohsen Mahdawi, who was slated for deportation, struck a defiant tone outside a courthouse in the northeastern state of Vermont.

title: Over 1,700 Money Laundering Cases In Trial Stage: Probe Agency ED
content: Over 1700 money laundering cases probed by Enforcement Directorate are currently in trial stage and the delay in courts can be attributed to general delay in the justice system in the country, Enforcement Directorate Director Rahul Navin said.

title: Why This El Salvador Prison Is At Heart Of Trump Immigration Crackdown
content: Deep within a rural district shielded by armed checkpoints and dense foliage lies one of the world's most controversial incarceration sites - the Terrorism Confinement Centre, or Cecot.

title: "Like Indian 'Khana', Indian 'Gaana' Will Also Become Popular": PM At WAVES Summit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi said that the WAVES summit will lay the foundation for a global ecosystem housing international talent and creativity.

title: What Is Trump Administration's New Policy To Target Foreign Students In US
content: Amid a wider crackdown on immigration, the Trump Administration in the United States is expanding the ways to strip international students, including Indians, of their legal status to stay in stay and study in the country.

title: UP Woman, Facing Dowry Harassment, Kills Self As Husband Gives Triple Talaq Over Call
content: Police suspended a sub-inspector and ordered a departmental inquiry for failing to lodge a case on a complaint regarding dowry harassment.

title: Global Nuclear Fusion Project Ready With World's Most Powerful Magnet
content: ITER said that the final component of the system, the central solenoid, had been completed and tested by the United States, and assembly was now underway.

title: "Lives In His Own World": High Court Slams Ramdev For New Video On Rooh Afza
content: The Delhi High Court on Thursday slammed Yoga guru Ramdev after it was informed that he had once again published a video containing disparaging remarks against the herbal drink Rooh Afza, in apparent violation of the court's earlier directive.

title: "Don't Pretend To Be Deaf, Dumb": China Claims Covid-19 Originated In US
content: China's white paper accused Washington of evading responsibility and attempting to distract from its mishandling of the pandemic.

title: Communal Tension Erupts In Nainital After Minor's Sex Assault
content: Tension broke out in Nainital after a 12-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by a 60-year-old man, triggering protests and vandalism.

title: Terrorists Behind Pahalgam Attack Also Killed 6 Labourers, Doctor In 2024
content: The terror module responsible for the deadly attack on tourists in Pahalgam's Baisaran Valley on April 22, which killed 26 people, has been linked to a prior attack in 2024 in the Ganderbal district of Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Inzaghi: Phenoms like Yamal 'born every 50 years'
